dta.PhaseMovement¶

class PhaseMovement(movement, capacityTag)¶

Bases: object

Represents a movement specific to a particular phase. This is basically a Movement with an annotation of whether the Movement is permitted or protected.

Does this really need to be its own class? It’s really just a tuple [Movement, permitted|protected]

Constructor. movement is an instance of Movement. capacityTag is one of PhaseMovement.PROTECTED or PhaseMovement.PERMITTED

__init__(movement, capacityTag)¶

Constructor. movement is an instance of Movement. capacityTag is one of PhaseMovement.PROTECTED or PhaseMovement.PERMITTED

Methods

__init__(movement, capacityTag) Constructor.
getDynameqStr() Return the dynameq string representaton of the phase
getMovement() Return the underlying Movement of the phase movement
isPermitted() Return True if the movement is permitted otherwise False
isProtected() Return True if the movement is protected otherwise False
setPermitted() Sets the phase movement as permitted
setProtected() Sets the phase movement as protected

Attributes

PERMITTED int(x[, base]) -> integer
PROTECTED int(x[, base]) -> integer
PERMITTED = 2¶

The movement is permitted under this phase

PROTECTED = 1¶

The movement is protected under this phase

getDynameqStr()¶

Return the dynameq string representaton of the phase movement

getMovement()¶

Return the underlying Movement of the phase movement

isPermitted()¶

Return True if the movement is permitted otherwise False

isProtected()¶

Return True if the movement is protected otherwise False

setPermitted()¶

Sets the phase movement as permitted

setProtected()¶

Sets the phase movement as protected
